featured.text: Just a few miles west, there’s a dry region that receives a mere 6 inches of rain annually.
28 already shrunk by 85% to a mere 0.5 square kilometers, Papua’s glaciers will completely disappear within a decade, researchers have predicted.
The wide selection is a sure sign that in many consumers’ minds, digital cameras have risen from mere gadgets to must-have items.

definition.zh_def: 僅僅的，單純的，沒有其他的
definition.en_def: Used to emphasize how small or insignificant something is.
definition.example: It was a mere coincidence that we met at the café.
